info.title: Meraki Dashboard API
info.description:
The Cisco Meraki Dashboard API is a modern REST API based on the OpenAPI specification.

> Date: 02 November, 2022
>
> [Recent Updates](https://meraki.io/whats-new/)

---

[API Documentation](https://meraki.io/api)

[Community Support](https://meraki.io/community)

[Meraki Homepage](https://www.meraki.com)

get.description: Returns the identity of the current user.

lastUsedDashboardAt.description: Last seen active on Dashboard UI

created.description: If API key is created for this user

enabled.description: If twoFactor authentication is enabled for this user
If SAML authentication is enabled for this user

get.summary: Returns the identity of the current user.

put.description: Update the attributes of a device

tags.description: The list of tags of a device

notes.description: The notes for the device. String. Limited to 255 characters.

moveMapMarker.description: Whether or not to set the latitude and longitude of a device based on the new address. Only applies when lat and lng are not specified.

switchProfileId.description: The ID of a switch profile to bind to the device (for available switch profiles, see the 'Switch Profiles' endpoint). Use null to unbind the switch device from the current profile. For a device to be bindable to a switch profile, it must (1) be a switch, and (2) belong to a network that is bound to a configuration template.

floorPlanId.description: The floor plan to associate to this device. null disassociates the device from the floorplan.

put.summary: Update the attributes of a device

get.description: Return the DHCP subnet information for an appliance
get.summary: Return the DHCP subnet information for an appliance

get.description: Return the performance score for a single MX. Only primary MX devices supported. If no data is available, a 204 error code is returned.
get.summary: Return the performance score for a single MX

get.description: Return current delegated IPv6 prefixes on an appliance.
get.summary: Return current delegated IPv6 prefixes on an appliance.

get.description: Return prefixes assigned to all IPv6 enabled VLANs on an appliance.
get.summary: Return prefixes assigned to all IPv6 enabled VLANs on an appliance.

get.description: Return the uplink settings for an MX appliance

vlanId.description: The ID of the VLAN to use for VLAN tagging.

assignmentMode.description: The assignment mode for this SVI. Applies only when PPPoE is disabled.

address.description: IP address and subnet mask when in static mode.

gateway.description: Gateway IP address when in static mode.

addresses.description: Up to 2 nameserver addresses to use, ordered in priority from highest to lowest priority.

nameservers.description: The nameserver settings for this SVI.

put.summary: Update the uplink settings for an MX appliance

post.description: Generate a new vMX authentication token

token.description: The newly generated authentication token for the vMX instance

expiresAt.description: The expiration time for the token, in ISO 8601 format

post.summary: Generate a new vMX authentication token

post.description: Blink the LEDs on a device

duration.description: The duration in seconds. Must be between 5 and 120. Default is 20 seconds

period.description: The period in milliseconds. Must be between 100 and 1000. Default is 160 milliseconds

duty.description: The duty cycle as the percent active. Must be between 10 and 90. Default is 50.

post.summary: Blink the LEDs on a device

get.description: Returns live state from camera of analytics zones
get.summary: Returns live state from camera of analytics zones

get.description: Returns an overview of aggregate analytics data for a timespan

parameters.name: t0
parameters.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 365 days from today.

parameters.name: t1
parameters.description: The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 7 days after t0.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 7 days. The default is 1 hour.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: [optional] The object type for which analytics will be retrieved. The default object type is person. The available types are [person, vehicle].

get.summary: Returns an overview of aggregate analytics data for a timespan

get.description: Returns most recent record for analytics zones

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: [optional] The object type for which analytics will be retrieved. The default object type is person. The available types are [person, vehicle].

get.summary: Returns most recent record for analytics zones

get.description: Returns all configured analytic zones for this camera
get.summary: Returns all configured analytic zones for this camera

get.description: Return historical records for analytic zones

parameters.name: t0
parameters.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 365 days from today.

parameters.name: t1
parameters.description: The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 14 hours after t0.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 14 hours. The default is 1 hour.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: The time resolution in seconds for returned data. The valid resolutions are: 60. The default is 60.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: [optional] The object type for which analytics will be retrieved. The default object type is person. The available types are [person, vehicle].

get.summary: Return historical records for analytic zones

get.description: Return custom analytics settings for a camera
get.summary: Return custom analytics settings for a camera

put.description: Update custom analytics settings for a camera

artifactId.description: The ID of the custom analytics artifact

parameters.description: Parameters for the custom analytics workload

put.summary: Update custom analytics settings for a camera
